intro: Xysmalobium lapathifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are blue to purple in color. Xysmalobium lapathifolium is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, delicate flowers.
